definition: one watch (i.e. two-hour period during night)
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
first of the five night watch periods 19:00-21:00 (old)
in sequence/in the proper order/one by one/in turn
fall short by a large amount
disobedient/to violate the Mandate of Heaven (天命[Tian1 Ming4])
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
soldier's copper saucepan, used for cooking food by day and for sounding the night watches during the hours of darkness (in ancient times)
